column4: Ubuntu has been hanging a lot lately; hanging to the point I have to restart the entire computer.  When it's happened, the only applications open (other than normal GNOME stuff) were Firefox and GNOME Terminal.  Is there any way to tell whether the hangs were caused by Firefox or by the Ubuntu base system?
your best bet would be to start firefox and terminal each in a terminal, that way any errors should show up in the terminal where you started the app
opening it in a terminal wouldn't help much with a hang ;)  I can move the mouse, but nothing else is responsive
but if you have the terminal open in a corner, you would still be able to read it even if you couldn't click on it or anyhthing
it would only be a way to possibly see an error indication for the hangup
that's a possibility, at least if stuff really is responding, though at this point I'd doubt it
